security_audit.summary: This skill provides GitHub label and milestone management utilities. It contains Python helper scripts that interact with the gh CLI to perform repository operations. All subprocess calls use hardcoded commands without dynamic construction. Filesystem access is limited to reading local JSON presets. No network calls except through the official GitHub CLI. No credential theft, persistence mechanisms, or obfuscation detected.

content.value_statement: Managing GitHub issues becomes chaotic without consistent organization. This skill provides label taxonomy design, bulk operations, milestone creation, and progress tracking to keep issues organized and teams aligned.
actual_capabilities: Create, update, and delete GitHub labels with consistent naming
Apply label presets (standard, comprehensive, minimal) in bulk
Analyze issues and suggest appropriate labels automatically
Create milestones with due dates and track progress
Bulk assign issues to milestones for sprint planning
Generate label usage reports and fix consistency issues
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) to be installed and authenticated
Cannot create or modify GitHub organization-level labels
Label inference is keyword-based and may suggest incorrect labels
Cannot automate label application without user confirmation for bulk operations

use_cases.title: Bulk organize issues

output: ‚úì Created: bug, feature, enhancement, docs, refactor, test

best_practices: Use consistent naming with prefixes like priority:, scope:, and status: for easy filtering
Start with a minimal label set and expand as needed to avoid decision paralysis
Apply labels during issue creation using issue templates for automatic organization
Review label usage monthly to remove unused labels and maintain clarity
anti_patterns: Creating too many similar labels like bug-high, bug-medium, bug-low (use combinations instead)
Using spaces in label names or inconsistent capitalization
Applying more than 5 labels to a single issue
Using labels instead of milestones for time-based releases

faq.question: Does this skill work with private repositories?
faq.answer: Yes. The gh CLI handles authentication. Ensure you are logged in with gh auth login before using the skill.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with organization-level labels?
faq.answer: No. This skill only manages repository-level labels. Organization labels must be managed through GitHub settings.

faq.question: How many labels should my project have?
faq.answer: Most projects work well with 10-20 labels. Too many labels create confusion. Start minimal and add as needed.

faq.question: Does this skill modify existing issues?
faq.answer: Bulk operations can modify issues by adding or removing labels. The skill asks for confirmation before making changes.

faq.question: What happens if gh CLI is not installed?
faq.answer: The skill requires gh CLI for all operations. Install it from cli.github.com or via your package manager.

faq.question: How is this different from GitHub Projects?
faq.answer: Labels work at the issue level while Projects provide board views. Use labels for categorization and Projects for workflow visualization.
